term.title: floc

item.text: When a sol is colloidally unstable the formation of aggregates is called coagulation or flocculation. Some authors distinguish between coagulation and flocculation, the latter implying the formation of a loose or open network which may or may not separate macroscopically. The loose structure formed in this way is called a floc.
